Currently MTU for cloud networks is always set to 1500, which is not correct
for GRE segmentation and causes performance degradation. MTU value should also
depend on MTU settings of physical interfaces.
The only way to change MTU for Neutron private network is to use an additional
dnsmasq configuration file.

Change-Id: I1fa979639c187e6f6d416100efc2a6548e141c50
Closes-bug: #1411732
'}]
commit_message:
Set mtu for internal networks according to segmentation type

Currently MTU for cloud networks is always set to 1500, which is not correct
for GRE segmentation and causes performance degradation. MTU value should also
depend on MTU settings of physical interfaces.
The only way to change MTU for Neutron private network is to use an additional
dnsmasq configuration file.

Change-Id: I1fa979639c187e6f6d416100efc2a6548e141c50
Closes-bug: #1411732

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-15 08:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/new-ipxe-driver.rst'], 'message': 'New stateless iPXE driver

Add a new iPXE driver that will use advanced features of iPXE by scripting
the boot process to generate the PXE configuration on-the-fly and boot
images from a Swift temp URLs, so that we not cache anything in the
local conductor disk.

This is the stage 1 of proposing a spec for Liberty, in this stage we
should determine whether the idea is in the scope and in alignment with
project direction.

Change-Id: I6d74c02ef2de0693ec91029891fd67a7be849677
'}]
commit_message:
New stateless iPXE driver

Add a new iPXE driver that will use advanced features of iPXE by scripting
the boot process to generate the PXE configuration on-the-fly and boot
images from a Swift temp URLs, so that we not cache anything in the
local conductor disk.

This is the stage 1 of proposing a spec for Liberty, in this stage we
should determine whether the idea is in the scope and in alignment with
project direction.

Change-Id: I6d74c02ef2de0693ec91029891fd67a7be849677

commit_message:
Shifting _generate_random_name() call to utils

Rather than calling _generate_random_name() multiple times in scenarios.
Better to call it once inside utils.
Affected method _create_image() of glance secnario.
Closes- Bug: 1412014

Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shaifali Agrawal <agrawalshaifali09@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If0b6f358f4087d9c35d4af9cd4e22ea601c757d2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 09:51:47.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/test_orchestrator.py', 'cloudkitty/tenant_fetcher/__init__.py', 'cloudkitty/tenant_fetcher/keystone.py', 'cloudkitty/orchestrator.py', 'cloudkitty/common/config.py', 'cloudkitty/config.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Added support for pluggable tenant fetcher

CloudKitty doesn't rely on Keystone at all anymore.
Moved Keystone related code in a new driver so that tenant list fetching
can be pluggable.
Only keystone fetcher is implemented at the moment.

Change-Id: Ib9de445b93f16696e6b9d205a6101a902349b76e
"}]
commit_message:
Added support for pluggable tenant fetcher

CloudKitty doesn't rely on Keystone at all anymore.
Moved Keystone related code in a new driver so that tenant list fetching
can be pluggable.
Only keystone fetcher is implemented at the moment.

Change-Id: Ib9de445b93f16696e6b9d205a6101a902349b76e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-03 21:19:08.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': 'Remove unneeded MANIFEST.in

pbr includes the contents of git by default. The graft lines here will
at best cause unversioned things to be included in tarballs, and the
explicit includes only include things in git.

Tested by building an sdist before and after and checking - no
difference in contents.

Change-Id: Iabcfd017591f00fcb8e04b1fa78864271b1b8b34
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded MANIFEST.in

pbr includes the contents of git by default. The graft lines here will
at best cause unversioned things to be included in tarballs, and the
explicit includes only include things in git.

Tested by building an sdist before and after and checking - no
difference in contents.

Change-Id: Iabcfd017591f00fcb8e04b1fa78864271b1b8b34

commit_message:
Fix commands transfer in OpsGuide

The commands present in How to backport
Galera Pacemaker OCF script are split
incorrectly and, thus, cannot be used with
simply copying them from the guide and pasting
right into the terminal.

This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ia000bade42c0646a870b1e7f484067f1a1d1c82a
Closes-Bug: 1443919

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-04 13:13:51.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/manager.py'], 'message': 'Commit transactions after an exception in a task

Tasks are now executed in mules so when an exception
happens during an execution of one, task status is updated
but not commited to the database because mules start separate
transactions.

This patch adds a commit clause to the error handler in tasks.

Closes-bug: #1436821
Closes-bug: #1446651
Change-Id: I6c17d1cd88321940f2e23379965675e6b185ab1e
'}]
commit_message:
Commit transactions after an exception in a task

Tasks are now executed in mules so when an exception
happens during an execution of one, task status is updated
but not commited to the database because mules start separate
transactions.

This patch adds a commit clause to the error handler in tasks.

Closes-bug: #1436821
Closes-bug: #1446651
Change-Id: I6c17d1cd88321940f2e23379965675e6b185ab1e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 14:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_md_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/utils/md_utils.py'], 'message': '[IBP] Fix ValueError while parsing: mdadm --detail

Backport from 6.1

fuel-agent doesn't expect header from 'mdadm --detail' output where
'State' is not present.

fuel-agent should expect 2 types of headers:
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice State\n" (already supported)
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice\n" - addressed by this patch.

This patch is required to let fuel-agent consume both types of headers.

Additionally fuel-agent will start to log 'mdadm --detail' output to ease
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ie20db2c14bdc5669566a140a34d63d28c6115d11
Closes-Bug: #1446186
(cherry picked from commit 5283060fdef4e3125cefe1e4f2b2c24cc1698a7c)
'}]
commit_message:
[IBP] Fix ValueError while parsing: mdadm --detail

Backport from 6.1

fuel-agent doesn't expect header from 'mdadm --detail' output where
'State' is not present.

fuel-agent should expect 2 types of headers:
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice State\n" (already supported)
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice\n" - addressed by this patch.

This patch is required to let fuel-agent consume both types of headers.

Additionally fuel-agent will start to log 'mdadm --detail' output to ease
troubleshooting.

subject: Don't manage chmod for /etc/neutron and neutron.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 14:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Don't manage chmod for /etc/neutron and neutron.conf

Debian/Ubuntu & Fedora packaging use different modes that mean Puppet will
override the mode and break idempotency between runs.

This patch aims to drop the modes for /etc/neutron and neutron.conf to
ensure idempotency between runs.

[1] Second run of Puppet on Ubuntu:
/Stage[main]/Neutron/File[/etc/neutron]/mode: mode changed '0755' to
'0750'

Change-Id: I661b0ea94e151a47ab71355058f7ac971915c116
"}]
commit_message:
Don't manage chmod for /etc/neutron and neutron.conf

Debian/Ubuntu & Fedora packaging use different modes that mean Puppet will
override the mode and break idempotency between runs.

This patch aims to drop the modes for /etc/neutron and neutron.conf to
ensure idempotency between runs.

[1] Second run of Puppet on Ubuntu:
/Stage[main]/Neutron/File[/etc/neutron]/mode: mode changed '0755' to
'0750'

Change-Id: I661b0ea94e151a47ab71355058f7ac971915c116

commit_message:
Amendments to the introduction of policy.json

This is an amendment of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/166853/,
after additional information became available.
Specifically, information about the is_admin flag and a note on
tweaking policy.json are added, and some points reworded for
clarity.

While there is still room for improvement, the bug, previously
declared as partially fixed, can be closed now.

Change-Id: Ifd01bc4e367f65d6ce45c54a005bafb660535260
Closes-Bug: #1311067

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-04 14:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['RELEASE_NOTES.rst', 'os_doc_tools/resources/clients.yaml', 'os_doc_tools/commands.py'], 'message': 'Further improvements for openstack-auto-commands

* new command for trove-manage

* move client definitions into a YAML resource file
* support of the complete subcommand
* add new clients: barbican, designate, manila, magnetodb,
  manila, mistral, tuskar

Clients to be added in the future:

  * congress (module for python-openstackclient)
  * magnum (no released version)

  * zaqar (module for python-openstackclient)

Change-Id: I5ccb5af887749ec22a9d980e3b031de6a247041e
'}]
commit_message:
Further improvements for openstack-auto-commands

* new command for trove-manage
* automatically identify deprecated subcommands
* move client definitions into a YAML resource file
* support of the complete subcommand
* add new clients: barbican, designate, manila, magnetodb,
  manila, mistral, tuskar

Clients to be added in the future:

  * congress (module for python-openstackclient)
  * magnum (no released version)
  * murano (missing --version parameter)
  * zaqar (module for python-openstackclient)

Change-Id: I5ccb5af887749ec22a9d980e3b031de6a247041e

subject: Provide and use a options collapsing function
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-04 22:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/utils.py', 'tooz/drivers/mysql.py', 'tooz/tests/test_utils.py', 'tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py', 'tooz/drivers/zake.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/drivers/pgsql.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': 'Provide and use a options collapsing function

Instead of having each driver index the last value of
each option, when all current drivers do not actually care
about any of the other indexes we can just use and provide
a option collapsing function that we by default apply to
all the existing drivers options (to avoid needing to index
by -1).

This avoids a confusion point for new folks, and one that
does not currently really provide any value (no driver in
tree besides one option in the redis driver uses/consumes
or understands multiple options in the first place).

Change-Id: Ia2898d84fd0e54871b829f4a95786a33accc20b8
'}]
commit_message:
Provide and use a options collapsing function

Instead of having each driver index the last value of
each option, when all current drivers do not actually care
about any of the other indexes we can just use and provide
a option collapsing function that we by default apply to
all the existing drivers options (to avoid needing to index
by -1).

This avoids a confusion point for new folks, and one that
does not currently really provide any value (no driver in
tree besides one option in the redis driver uses/consumes
or understands multiple options in the first place).

Change-Id: Ia2898d84fd0e54871b829f4a95786a33accc20b8

subject: Allow providing the deprecation category
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 18:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['debtcollector/_utils.py', 'debtcollector/tests/test_deprecation.py', 'debtcollector/removals.py', 'debtcollector/renames.py', 'debtcollector/moves.py'], 'message': "Allow providing the deprecation category

Instead of always using 'DeprecationWarning' it can be useful
to allow for 'PendingDeprecationWarning' to be used instead (or
other category); so enable this category passing and usage
by providing yet another keyword argument (that when not provided
defaults to 'DeprecationWarning').

Change-Id: I6719afd44bae99da31d09d429f8aa9402af194fc
"}]
commit_message:
Allow providing the deprecation category

Instead of always using 'DeprecationWarning' it can be useful
to allow for 'PendingDeprecationWarning' to be used instead (or
other category); so enable this category passing and usage
by providing yet another keyword argument (that when not provided
defaults to 'DeprecationWarning').

Change-Id: I6719afd44bae99da31d09d429f8aa9402af194fc

commit_message:

subject: Fixed container user create issue
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-04 21:31:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-containers-create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I81d0e8b0d8e9e431cd8eebd43ceaffab7e61b207
Closes-Bug: 1437054
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I81d0e8b0d8e9e431cd8eebd43ceaffab7e61b207
Closes-Bug: 1437054

commit_message:
Add ScalingInPolicy and ScalingOutPolicy

These two simple scaling policies are just used to support some
existed use cases of autoscaling where user may want to define
webhook trigger condition without Senlin's help. In most cases,
users are recommonded to use ScalingPolicyComplex to provide
autoscaling support of a cluster.

Implements: blueprint scaling-policy-simple
Change-Id: I2ce01b68e055c94cebac230fce25adb0d04f14fa

subject: Fixes issues with tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-04 21:20:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fixes issues with tempest

The tempest role has an entry within the defaults of the role and
it could cause confusion when dealing with tempest as the main
package version is being specified in
`vars/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml`. Being that these
variables are no longer used they have been removed.

Implements blueprint: master-kilofication

Change-Id: I197afac1ce50d9bad778dda5cc4a23a0821fceeb
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes issues with tempest

The tempest role has an entry within the defaults of the role and
it could cause confusion when dealing with tempest as the main
package version is being specified in
`vars/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml`. Being that these
variables are no longer used they have been removed.

Implements blueprint: master-kilofication

Change-Id: I197afac1ce50d9bad778dda5cc4a23a0821fceeb

OpenStack projects use file openstack-common.conf to track modules copied
from oslo-incubator, developers need update this file before syncing code
if need. There is inconsistent issue, like copied modules are not tracked
in file openstack-common.conf or removed modules still exist in the
file. This commit check consistency between modules in openstack-common.conf
and oslo-incubator modules in directory 'openstack/common'.

commit_message:
Add module integrity check in update.py

OpenStack projects use file openstack-common.conf to track modules copied
from oslo-incubator, developers need update this file before syncing code
if need. There is inconsistent issue, like copied modules are not tracked
in file openstack-common.conf or removed modules still exist in the
file. This commit check consistency between modules in openstack-common.conf
and oslo-incubator modules in directory 'openstack/common'.

There is no usage change and only output warning and info message. This is
an usage example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/122027/

Closes-Bug: #1295582

Change-Id: I68c0108304be8a315bcefe939c22019caab9bc98

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-04-27 15:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: check qemu version for NUMA & hugepage support

In commit 945ab28 the libvirt driver was modified to validate the
libvirt version before enabling NUMA and hugepage support.

While good, it's not sufficient.  We also need to check the qemu
version since NUMA hugepage support wasn't added until version 2.1.
(See http://wiki.qemu.org/ChangeLog/2.1#x86, specifically the
memory-backend-* objects.)

We know that qemu on the s390x doesn't support NUMA or hugepages.
Support for ppc64 is possible but not yet determined...we can
update the supported list once we find out for sure.

Change-Id: Ib31c4f806e30a8b33669d5a15bd1578050c7e352
Closes-Bug: #1422775
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: check qemu version for NUMA & hugepage support

In commit 945ab28 the libvirt driver was modified to validate the
libvirt version before enabling NUMA and hugepage support.

While good, it's not sufficient.  We also need to check the qemu
version since NUMA hugepage support wasn't added until version 2.1.
(See http://wiki.qemu.org/ChangeLog/2.1#x86, specifically the
memory-backend-* objects.)

We know that qemu on the s390x doesn't support NUMA or hugepages.
Support for ppc64 is possible but not yet determined...we can
update the supported list once we find out for sure.

Change-Id: Ib31c4f806e30a8b33669d5a15bd1578050c7e352
Closes-Bug: #1422775

This function deletes all servers in the current tenant, which is
almost certainly The Wrong Thing. It's also poorly written: it deletes
the servers sequentially, not in parallel; and it creates multiple
timers for the same action. A subsequent commit will add support for
deleting multiple specific servers at once.

Change-Id: Ib381fcc93d77bf417ce7d90c90261ca0209c1bbb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _delete_all_servers() nova utils function

This function deletes all servers in the current tenant, which is
almost certainly The Wrong Thing. It's also poorly written: it deletes
the servers sequentially, not in parallel; and it creates multiple
timers for the same action. A subsequent commit will add support for
deleting multiple specific servers at once.

Change-Id: Ib381fcc93d77bf417ce7d90c90261ca0209c1bbb

subject: Actually set a sane PATH for inside chroot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 00:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions'], 'message': 'Actually set a sane PATH for inside chroot

In I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439 we attemped to address a
bug for systems which dont have a path that works well for inside a
chroot. Turns out there were multiple issues:
 * The PATH we were setting was after we attempted to call sh.
 * PATH was being set in a sibling process to the command being run.
 * PATH was not being exported so it was not effecting child processes.

Using env to set a sane path before we attempt to run our commands
addresses these issues.

Change-Id: I4285f8048465ee5c2490116447d32033007bd185
'}]
commit_message:
Actually set a sane PATH for inside chroot

In I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439 we attemped to address a
bug for systems which dont have a path that works well for inside a
chroot. Turns out there were multiple issues:
 * The PATH we were setting was after we attempted to call sh.
 * PATH was being set in a sibling process to the command being run.
 * PATH was not being exported so it was not effecting child processes.

Using env to set a sane path before we attempt to run our commands
addresses these issues.

Change-Id: I4285f8048465ee5c2490116447d32033007bd185

commit_message:
VMware: Enable vCenter certificate verification

Currently vCenter certificate is not verified during connection
establishment. This patch adds a config option to specify a CA
bundle file to verify vCenter server certificate.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ida730db66b154a4d445f7a91bccb9ca5b5a26f5e
Closes-Bug: #1276207

commit_message:

It's sometimes hard to find the option with a bad value.  In a
couple ConfigFileValueError cases, the option is not included in
the log message.

Closes-Bug: #1451479

Currently we have a instance_info alias for node.instance_info
but not for all, so move the alias before we use it to keep
code clean and consistent.

Change-Id: Id2ce5c4daa8514800ed2351f8dad122310081d61

commit_message:
Convergence prepare traversal

Generates the graph for traversal in convergence.

* Updates current traversal for the stack
* Deletes any sync_point entries of previous traversal
* Generates the graph for traversal based on
  - resources loaded from db for the stack
  - resources that exist in present template
* Stores resource.current_template_id and resource.requires
* Stores the edges of graph in stack.current_deps
* Creates sync_points for each node in graph
* Creates sync_point for stack.

blueprint convergence-prepare-traversal

Change-Id: I507e67b39c820ed46d3b269fc76d6cf18d0ef2d7

commit_message:
Adopt config generator

oslo.config.generator has been removed from olso-incubator so
we need to adopt it in order to generated up-to-date config
files.
Changes introduced:
- Move config/generator.py from openstack.common to ironic.common
- Update config generator to use new style list_opts discovery
- Split _print_opt function to reduce complexity and pass pep8 tests

Change-Id: I397504bf0604a86082f26e46952720117611f3a8

commit_message:
initial import of go code

Better build instructions coming...  For now, get yourself a saio with go
installed then do something like:

    mkdir -p $GOPATH/src/github.com/openstack
    ln -s ~/swift $GOPATH/src/github.com/openstack/swift
    cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/openstack/swift/go
    make get test all

Change-Id: Ie26249355eccb7d1c37565c42cf5df028b54a95f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-04 13:27:59.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Revised service API to use ClusterPolicy module

Revised some service APIs related to cluster-policy bindings. The revise
is mainly targeted at get and list apis. For other operations, we still
need a cluster lock, so we still use the action model to achieve that.

Change-Id: I5a083809cf8c6e98f1c614b2a634c7dad9c05424
'}]
commit_message:
Revised service API to use ClusterPolicy module

Revised some service APIs related to cluster-policy bindings. The revise
is mainly targeted at get and list apis. For other operations, we still
need a cluster lock, so we still use the action model to achieve that.

Change-Id: I5a083809cf8c6e98f1c614b2a634c7dad9c05424

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-04 20:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'requirements.txt', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Switch tasks vs put on a boolean config flag

Rackspace's requirement for task-create is a choice that is orthogonal
to the v2 choice. Make that decision point clear. Also, rename the
hidden methods just so that we're clear on what's happening.

Update to a more recent version of os-client-config, since that also has
support for the task-create flag.

Depends-On: I2cdcfe302a73ebfa7f739399c1eeb3bc9f96ab3c
Change-Id: I72bb5992eeb116f1338a090d997893b9ae93050c
"}]
commit_message:
Switch tasks vs put on a boolean config flag

Rackspace's requirement for task-create is a choice that is orthogonal
to the v2 choice. Make that decision point clear. Also, rename the
hidden methods just so that we're clear on what's happening.

Update to a more recent version of os-client-config, since that also has
support for the task-create flag.

Depends-On: I2cdcfe302a73ebfa7f739399c1eeb3bc9f96ab3c
Change-Id: I72bb5992eeb116f1338a090d997893b9ae93050c

commit_message:
Honour ssh_connect_method in test_baremetal_server_ops

This commit changes test_baremetal_server_ops to add
a floating IP and check SSH connectivity with floating IP
only if [compute]ssh_connect_method == 'floating'.

Change-Id: I13bfd76522ebddd68fd347758e4861150ebedbea

commit_message:
Add a "plain" image type

Move the current "plain" version of the "hdp" type in an own type,
implemented for all the distros.  This way it is possible to easily
generate an image without any Hadoop component, without duplicating that
as "plain" subtype of existing types:

 $ diskimage-create.sh -p plain -i ubuntu|fedora|centos

Change-Id: I73ac2dc650b3050b1f49ea5b28e90a90bc08faf3
Closes-Bug: #1439368

commit_message:
Allow zk jobboard backend to take custom loader/dumpers

In order to allow for alternative non-json serialization
strategies allow for the zk jobboard backend to take a loader
and dumper backend keyword arguments which can be replaced
with msgpackutils or other serialization strategies.

Change-Id: I0a333407739e50e3f46642f877d4eb334e18f911

commit_message:
Allow dir and zk backend to take custom loader/dumpers

In order to allow for alternative non-json serialization
strategies allow for the dir and zk backend to take a loader
and dumper backend keyword arguments which can be replaced
with msgpackutils or other serialization strategies.

Change-Id: I13138d3f38ced9f994f7985cb5432d0a67e4c7eb

subject: Fixed container user create issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-04 16:07:55.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/container_create/tasks/container_create.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/setup/build-containers.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/setup/containers-password.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I46d8d407028485ad99f89347bf93354ed5043150
Closes-Bug: 1437054
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I46d8d407028485ad99f89347bf93354ed5043150
Closes-Bug: 1437054

subject: Generate stack events for stack state transitions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 7256, 'name': 'Randall Burt', 'email': 'randall.burt@rackspace.com', 'username': 'randall-burt'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12321, 'name': 'Ryan Brown', 'email': 'rybrown@redhat.com', 'username': 'ryansb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-01 15:40:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Generate stack events for stack state transitions

Currently, the event-list output is very resource-centric, despite
being scoped to the stack from an API path perspective.

This, combined with the fact that the stack updated_at timestamp
is only updated after a succesful update (ref bug #1193269) makes
it impossible to derive the time when an update started via any API.

This is a problem when trying to use the new hook/breakpoint API,
because it's necessary to poll for all events since the most recent
update started, disregarding any stale hook events from previous
updates (which may have failed or timed out without the hooks getting
cleared).

To work around this, add an event for each stack state transition,
such that you can detect the transition to UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS,
then use that event as a marker to get post-update-started events.

Without this (or some other way to determine when the stack update
started), the hooks pre-update functionality landed for kilo is
not really usable (particularly mechanically via scripts).

Change-Id: Idff342b3aecc2d145dfbc7c0f610ad0ca8e52c8b
Partial-Bug: #1448155
"}]
commit_message:
Generate stack events for stack state transitions

Currently, the event-list output is very resource-centric, despite
being scoped to the stack from an API path perspective.

This, combined with the fact that the stack updated_at timestamp
is only updated after a succesful update (ref bug #1193269) makes
it impossible to derive the time when an update started via any API.

This is a problem when trying to use the new hook/breakpoint API,
because it's necessary to poll for all events since the most recent
update started, disregarding any stale hook events from previous
updates (which may have failed or timed out without the hooks getting
cleared).

To work around this, add an event for each stack state transition,
such that you can detect the transition to UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS,
then use that event as a marker to get post-update-started events.

Without this (or some other way to determine when the stack update
started), the hooks pre-update functionality landed for kilo is
not really usable (particularly mechanically via scripts).

Change-Id: Idff342b3aecc2d145dfbc7c0f610ad0ca8e52c8b
Partial-Bug: #1448155

commit_message:
Fix exponentially growing AJAX updates for table rows

Schedule next table rows update only when the last row was
updated. Since unit-test for this fix relies on a blueprint
replace-qunit-tests-with-jasmine it is moved to a separate commit to
speed up this fix merge, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179013/

Closes-Bug: #1263665
(cherry picked from commit ca090378b4875afebdebd67bdb457eebad6b2b7d)

Conflict Resolution Notes:
cherry-pick needed to have the old body of the complete: function
manually removed - it wasn't sure if it still belonged (resulting in
nearly duplicate code) or should be removed. I'm a bit surprised the
cherry-pick didn't auto-resolve.

Conflicts:
	horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js

Change-Id: Id603a4fde5713d8f2b85b1dcf72c82c93a87c755

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 18:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_read_write_util.py'], 'message': "VMWare: Isolate unit tests from requests

The test_ipv6_host_read actually tested all the way down to the
requests url call, which means it's testing a lot of function
unrelated to the nova code. The interesting part of this test seems to
be that it builds the ipv6 url correctly.

Change this into an assert based on that url being correct. We still
need to mock out the http connection because that's done magically in
__init__.

Unblocks nova patches, which are failing on unit test since the latest
requests release and one of the function signatures changing.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_read_write_util.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to commit 80a63292c on master
not being in stable/kilo.

Change-Id: I8ae4cb00e63cbb0304210dba2cd4993016d852ba
Closes-bug: #1451389
(cherry picked from commit 117351d6c46bd6d00cc92fcd234d67a913833cbc)
"}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Isolate unit tests from requests

The test_ipv6_host_read actually tested all the way down to the
requests url call, which means it's testing a lot of function
unrelated to the nova code. The interesting part of this test seems to
be that it builds the ipv6 url correctly.

Change this into an assert based on that url being correct. We still
need to mock out the http connection because that's done magically in
__init__.

Unblocks nova patches, which are failing on unit test since the latest
requests release and one of the function signatures changing.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_read_write_util.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to commit 80a63292c on master
not being in stable/kilo.

Change-Id: I8ae4cb00e63cbb0304210dba2cd4993016d852ba
Closes-bug: #1451389
(cherry picked from commit 117351d6c46bd6d00cc92fcd234d67a913833cbc)

commit_message:
update .tx/config to match Kilo Transifex resources

Transifex resource name for master branch is named as "djangopo"
which is not appropriate. For stable branch, we use
"openstack-auth-<release>" for Transifex resource name.

The corresponding Transifex resource is already prepared.

Change-Id: I4738db5402dddd8cf1c92af902aa261dc1aae6c1

subject: Fixed container user create issue
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 18:40:11.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/playbooks/setup/build-containers.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/container_create/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/setup/containers-password.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: Id1d142dda967921450ddcecb0d7f70baf2218a42
Closes-Bug: 1437054
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: Id1d142dda967921450ddcecb0d7f70baf2218a42
Closes-Bug: 1437054

subject: Fix intermittent container replicator test failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 09:58:19.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_replicator.py'], 'message': "Fix intermittent container replicator test failure

Intermittent failure of this test could be due to
insufficient time elapsing between either the local
and remote db's being created or during the
debug_timing calls. This patch forces greater timestamp
separation and forces debug_timing to always log timings.

Also add message to the failign assertion so if this does
fail again we get some clue as to why.

Closes-Bug: 1369663

Change-Id: I4b69b2e759d586a14abd0931a68dbdf256d57c32
"}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent container replicator test failure

Intermittent failure of this test could be due to
insufficient time elapsing between either the local
and remote db's being created or during the
debug_timing calls. This patch forces greater timestamp
separation and forces debug_timing to always log timings.

Also add message to the failign assertion so if this does
fail again we get some clue as to why.

Closes-Bug: 1369663

Change-Id: I4b69b2e759d586a14abd0931a68dbdf256d57c32

commit_message:
add script to generate release note email bodies

Produce the email body, ready to send (including headers), without
actually sending it. This gives us a chance to review the file
before sending, and then we can use another tool to actually send
the messages.

Change-Id: Ib53b0f9597a5508e53c4485fe690cd1299ad9e84

subject: Fixed ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 not supported by Python 2.7.9
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 16:29:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/sslutils.py'], 'message': "Fixed ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 not supported by Python 2.7.9

Python 2.7.9 doesn't support ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 by default anymore due to
security issues(POODLE attack). We should remove the usage of
ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 in oslo-incubator.

This is a backport of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162853/
which we need for Icehouse to run in Debian (in Jessie, each and every
package carry a specific patch, which isn't ideal at all...).

Change-Id: I41c6598cb874b79c391f8b4e4607b85c4660bd2f
Closes-Bug: 1395095
(cherry picked from commit de2d03023ec9e3fb35bdbfca970462f677cd2902)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 not supported by Python 2.7.9

Python 2.7.9 doesn't support ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 by default anymore due to
security issues(POODLE attack). We should remove the usage of
ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 in oslo-incubator.

This is a backport of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162853/
which we need for Icehouse to run in Debian (in Jessie, each and every
package carry a specific patch, which isn't ideal at all...).

Change-Id: I41c6598cb874b79c391f8b4e4607b85c4660bd2f
Closes-Bug: 1395095
(cherry picked from commit de2d03023ec9e3fb35bdbfca970462f677cd2902)

commit_message:
Stop re-invoking pip

It turns out we need to just inject into install_requires so that pip's
egg_info processing will do the right thing for dependencies.

Change-Id: Ia6c4725b153b19c3d7e422b1fa62b70cded686e2

subject: Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 19:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0

This change was made to ensure that PBR is using version < 0.11.0.
This is because changes in upstream PBR have made it impossible to
build contributing packages in heat and will likely impact other
services until the switch to liberty is in full effect. To ensure
consistent building of OpenStack packages PBR is now being installed
in the repo server containers which will ensure there are no
assumptions being made when creating python packages from OpenStack
contributing sources that may not be as well maintained as others.

Change-Id: I20c216543e63ef142119c2625fb219e030a708dd
Partial-bug: 1450733
(cherry picked from commit 688516acf0cd3f658b9c0c46ca877ca1b9b7edd3)
'}]
commit_message:
Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0

This change was made to ensure that PBR is using version < 0.11.0.
This is because changes in upstream PBR have made it impossible to
build contributing packages in heat and will likely impact other
services until the switch to liberty is in full effect. To ensure
consistent building of OpenStack packages PBR is now being installed
in the repo server containers which will ensure there are no
assumptions being made when creating python packages from OpenStack
contributing sources that may not be as well maintained as others.

Change-Id: I20c216543e63ef142119c2625fb219e030a708dd
Partial-bug: 1450733
(cherry picked from commit 688516acf0cd3f658b9c0c46ca877ca1b9b7edd3)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-03 05:45:02.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/cfg.py', 'etc/trove/trove.conf.test', 'etc/trove/trove.conf.sample'], 'message': "Change 'connection' default to sqlite:////var/lib/trove/trove.sqlite

Most of packages are running dbsync with default configuration while and
it fails because of default 'connection' parameter set to
sqlite:///trove_test.sqlite [1].

This patch changes the default to sqlite:////var/lib/trove/trove.sqlite

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/214767/
Closes-bug: #1451134

Change-Id: I7ca80543640949942427748852cda69cb37d1125
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'connection' default to sqlite:////var/lib/trove/trove.sqlite

Most of packages are running dbsync with default configuration while and
it fails because of default 'connection' parameter set to
sqlite:///trove_test.sqlite [1].

This patch changes the default to sqlite:////var/lib/trove/trove.sqlite

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/214767/
Closes-bug: #1451134

Change-Id: I7ca80543640949942427748852cda69cb37d1125

commit_message:
Use a socket timeout in get_auth

A previous change added socket timeouts, but they weren't plumbed
through to the get_auth code path. Make sure we're passing them along
everywhere.

Original-Author: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I398241898248e66d1f8c436c8ed2ec7a0e9387f6
Closes-bug: 1447847

commit_message:
update openstackclient requirement to 1.0.3

devstack on stable/kilo definitely doesn't work with 1.0.1, as it uses
commands that don't yet exist. 1.0.3 is what's currently being tested,
and 1.0.2 seems suspect.

subject: Bump requests version support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 7049, 'name': 'Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)', 'email': 'wkq5325@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kennan'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-23 01:24:01.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump requests version support

1. During the magnum gate job run, we use docker-py, and the pip
install default is
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker-py/1.1.0
which it requires requests >= 2.5.2
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/setup.py

But in devstack stack.sh install in ubuntu, it uses requests 2.2.1
It seems use system package 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
http://logs.openstack.org/54/173154/1/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/7fa79f3/logs/dpkg-l.txt.gz

It then cause conflict for magnum, as docker-py require newer version than 2.2.1
Error logs as:
http://logs.openstack.org/54/173154/1/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/7fa79f3/console.html#_2015-04-14_05_45_54_797

For magnum code refer:
https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/requirements.txt

2. We once tried to use older docker-py(0.7~1.0) version, but in tox -e py27
the pip install requests is latest 2.6.0, which broke docker-py which requests
requests >= 2.2.1, < 2.5.0

As magnum depends on global requirements for devstack, So we only have to
choose bump requests version to latest 2.6.0.

Change-Id: Ic55f1d70093472e59417d215bb3f0c5276a678de
'}]
commit_message:
Bump requests version support

1. During the magnum gate job run, we use docker-py, and the pip
install default is
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker-py/1.1.0
which it requires requests >= 2.5.2
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/setup.py

But in devstack stack.sh install in ubuntu, it uses requests 2.2.1
It seems use system package 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
http://logs.openstack.org/54/173154/1/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/7fa79f3/logs/dpkg-l.txt.gz

It then cause conflict for magnum, as docker-py require newer version than 2.2.1
Error logs as:
http://logs.openstack.org/54/173154/1/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/7fa79f3/console.html#_2015-04-14_05_45_54_797

For magnum code refer:
https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/requirements.txt

2. We once tried to use older docker-py(0.7~1.0) version, but in tox -e py27
the pip install requests is latest 2.6.0, which broke docker-py which requests
requests >= 2.2.1, < 2.5.0

As magnum depends on global requirements for devstack, So we only have to
choose bump requests version to latest 2.6.0.

Change-Id: Ic55f1d70093472e59417d215bb3f0c5276a678de

subject: clean up logging around run_process
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 02:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'clean up logging around run_process

We do a bunch of exec magic unwind in run_process that leads to a lot
of confusing lines in the logs under xtrace. Instead, disable xtrace
through these parts to ensure that the flow at the end of the day
makes more sense.

Change-Id: I91e02465240e704a1a0c0036f5073c0295be018e
'}]
commit_message:
clean up logging around run_process

We do a bunch of exec magic unwind in run_process that leads to a lot
of confusing lines in the logs under xtrace. Instead, disable xtrace
through these parts to ensure that the flow at the end of the day
makes more sense.

Change-Id: I91e02465240e704a1a0c0036f5073c0295be018e

commit_message:
Don't use SessionClient for version-list API

The endpoint of version API doesn't contain "/v2/{project-id}" and it is
just "/". SessionClient is based on the endpoint "/v2/{project-id}/...",
so this patch makes a client use a raw url for version-list API.

Change-Id: I53f2afacce2dda14ac9761e824b48887f7c192f9
Closes-Bug: #1444235

subject: Fix RBD delete image on creation failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 16:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'Fix RBD delete image on creation failure

When an exception rises on RBD store while adding/creating an image, and
the image has already been created, this new image is not properly
deleted as it should be.

Fault lies in incorrect call to Store._delete_image method, as it is
called with the wrong arguments.

Change-Id: Ib74f7eafbb04ab893039b480a7d3eaa15e7d59d1
Closes-Bug: #1449639
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RBD delete image on creation failure

When an exception rises on RBD store while adding/creating an image, and
the image has already been created, this new image is not properly
deleted as it should be.

Fault lies in incorrect call to Store._delete_image method, as it is
called with the wrong arguments.

Change-Id: Ib74f7eafbb04ab893039b480a7d3eaa15e7d59d1
Closes-Bug: #1449639

commit_message:
Disable voting for puppet-syntax-future on havana/icehouse

We recently enabled voting for puppet-syntax-future jobs.
The recent rspec refactor & update has not been backported until
stable/icehouse and stable/havana, so until we figure out how to deal
with these stable branches and rspec version, let's disable the job
on icehouse and havana to unblock stable CI.

Change-Id: Iea11c4b5809cd6bf82ddcd49db7e10540bcc3714
Partial-bug: #1451460

subject: Fixed container user create issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-04 16:23:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-containers-create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I81d0e8b0d8e9e431cd8eebd43ceaffab7e61b207
Closes-Bug: 1437054
(cherry pick from commit 8efb09f90dae73a21ec3dc21842fe28e668ead39)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed container user create issue

This patch resolves an issue where the LXC container create user
password is being hard coded due to how the default LXC container
template is being used. The template allows for a container to be
created without specifying a password at create time however when
doing this the default LXC template will create a user and a
password based on the linux distribution's name. This means that
all users of a "ubuntu" template will have a "ubuntu" user which
will have a "ubuntu" password. While the container user must exist
the password does not need to be known to the end user/deployer
because there are other means to gain access to a container from
within the host. So to correct this issue for all deployers as
well as all future deployments this patch ensures that the container
user is created with a random password and provides for an additional
tag to allow the deployer to regenerate the password at will.

Change-Id: I81d0e8b0d8e9e431cd8eebd43ceaffab7e61b207
Closes-Bug: 1437054
(cherry pick from commit 8efb09f90dae73a21ec3dc21842fe28e668ead39)

commit_message:
Rename get_endpoint() to get_session_endpoint()

In a subsequent change, we will add Keystone endpoint methods.
In that change, get_endpoint() would return an endpoint by id, as done
by other get_<resource>() methods.
This change renames get_endpoint() in OpenStackCloud with a more
appropriate name, as it returns the current session endpoints.

Change-Id: Ie91f97457fb164255d2adf4e84c1b1f729e797b0

As the cinder::backup class doesn't configure any backend by default,

commit_message:
Configure cinder-backup for Ceph backend

As the cinder::backup class doesn't configure any backend by default,
cinder::backup::ceph has to be defined explicitly. Additionally
cinder-backup requires a seperate client and pool for storing backups.
The user has to have read access to regular cinder's pool in order to
actually backup anything.

Change-Id: I445a03840a7ef17a799d99f161d874df99821eef
Closes-Bug: 1446593

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iae62b48993eef3b31420f8cc245a55f5e303c4fc

commit_message:
Add xags argument to get_active_vioses

The get_active_vioses operation was added to the vios.py recently.
However, all calls down to it were with xags=None.  Most of the
invocations want the active VIOS with the appropriate XAGs.

This change set allows for an optional parameter to get the XAGs.

Change-Id: Ied9b264b8062aa7d3594101ee5d91c9fcff98c68

removes it. Future patches will bring it back to support the management
plane.

commit_message:
Add support for Glance RBD backend

This patch adds support for a new GlanceBackend setting
which can be set to one of swift, rbd, or file to control
which Glance backend is configured for use by default.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9746, 'name': 'Doug Shelley', 'email': 'dougshelley66@gmail.com', 'username': 'dougshelley'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-01-28 09:52:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/processutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/tests/unit/test_processutils.py'], 'message': 'New API allow clients to execute a pipeline of commands

Currently, several clients of execute() who wish to execute a pipeline
of commands need to do this using a literal string and specifying
"shell=True" in the invocation of subprocess.Popen(). This change
allows users to construct a pipeline of commands, potentially
including sudo, and execute that entire pipeline without requiring
shell=True.

The new API execute_pipeline() takes a subset of the parameters that
execute() accepts and constructs and executes the pipeline, returning
the stdout, stderr and returncode. Similar to execute() this API will
log some information after sanitizing through strutils.mask_password()
and will return stdout and stderr that have been similarly
sanitized.

Also, similar to execute() this API computes total time and logs it in
the same way that execute() does.

I have also reviewed the package 'sarge' and a very quick assessment
indicates that it isn't as fast as the present implementation and in
the short term, I think an implementation similar to execute() would
be preferable. I'll look to wrap sarge and potentially reimplement
processutils based on it independently.

Test cases have been proposed as well.

Change-Id: I8b911a41acdd5cd63c0ae66c359c9e0fbc148fea
Closes-Bug: #1413751
'}]
commit_message:
New API allow clients to execute a pipeline of commands

Currently, several clients of execute() who wish to execute a pipeline
of commands need to do this using a literal string and specifying
"shell=True" in the invocation of subprocess.Popen(). This change
allows users to construct a pipeline of commands, potentially
including sudo, and execute that entire pipeline without requiring
shell=True.

The new API execute_pipeline() takes a subset of the parameters that
execute() accepts and constructs and executes the pipeline, returning
the stdout, stderr and returncode. Similar to execute() this API will
log some information after sanitizing through strutils.mask_password()
and will return stdout and stderr that have been similarly
sanitized.

Also, similar to execute() this API computes total time and logs it in
the same way that execute() does.

I have also reviewed the package 'sarge' and a very quick assessment
indicates that it isn't as fast as the present implementation and in
the short term, I think an implementation similar to execute() would
be preferable. I'll look to wrap sarge and potentially reimplement
processutils based on it independently.

Test cases have been proposed as well.

Change-Id: I8b911a41acdd5cd63c0ae66c359c9e0fbc148fea
Closes-Bug: #1413751

commit_message:
Have run_watchers take a timeout and respect it

Like the rest of the functions in coordinators they
should try to take and respect timeouts wherever possible,
so the run_watcher method (which calls into various async
functions) should also take a timeout, and try to respect it
where possible.

Change-Id: I2558a54f69dc5033c3a73351c4f7fbff7bdd6297

commit_message:
Use dhcp_gateway for admin network GW if it's set

We have a special setting "DHCP Gateway" in fuelmenu
(which is stored as 'dhcp_gateway' in astute.yaml) and
was added in order to set default GW for PXE/admin
network. Use master node IP as gateway only when that
parameter is not set.

Change-Id: I1f7caad9c52feeba8c19ef800351ab0d90c47d08
Closes-bug: #1451222

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: name FK constraints

We didn't name the foreign keys constraint which is going to make
upgrade very painful in the future. Let's do that right now before
having 1.0 and freezing our schema.

Change-Id: I5b6902b9db7d8f74984df35b149bf0eb5d825b2c
(cherry picked from commit 9a684c02dec30e68e2db5ca3a2efb86071a126d3)

commit_message:
Updated merge that avoid duplicating named instances in a config.

Skip config writing and restart if there are no changes to the config.
Added names to various config instances to aid in repeat runs of setup.

Change-Id: Idd29f8abe29b4889868a9044116cbdcdfdba6262

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-29 11:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/zmq-work-without-eventlet.rst'], 'message': 'Make ZeroMQ driver work without eventlet

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-work-without-eventlet

Oslo.messaging ZeroMQ driver lacks the ability to work without eventlet.
:meth:`eventlet.spawn` is heavily used across the driver with no alternatives.

Provide an alternative way of calling methods to use with blocking executor.

Change-Id: I8d3697b7395236992e23a94edd9f10be3410b108
'}]
commit_message:
Make ZeroMQ driver work without eventlet

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-work-without-eventlet

Oslo.messaging ZeroMQ driver lacks the ability to work without eventlet.
:meth:`eventlet.spawn` is heavily used across the driver with no alternatives.

Provide an alternative way of calling methods to use with blocking executor.

Change-Id: I8d3697b7395236992e23a94edd9f10be3410b108

commit_message:
remove metadata_proxy_local filters for rootwrap

With the dependent patch Iade8b5b09bb53018485c85f8372fb94dbc2ad2da,
/usr/local/bin is added to exec_dirs in rootwrap.conf. Therefore, these
filters are no longer needed for devstack use case.

Depends-On: Iade8b5b09bb53018485c85f8372fb94dbc2ad2da
Change-Id: I98bff3cc679dfe19315f2b9b028ff48e4296e0de

commit_message:
Rename service to zaqar

Instead of using `zaqar-server` as the service name in devstack, use
zaqar. This will allow for future services to be added.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 13:08:14.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py'], 'message': 'Fixes the unsafe mocking in test_dbaas

test_dbaas.MySqlAppMockTest.test_secure_with_mycnf_error
contains a mocked entry for operating_system.service_discovery.
This entry is unsafe and it has not been unmocked, also

It looks to me the primary reason for this bug: 1450789.

Made the mocking safe by the usage of "with patch.object(..." usage

Closes-Bug: #1450789
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes the unsafe mocking in test_dbaas

test_dbaas.MySqlAppMockTest.test_secure_with_mycnf_error
contains a mocked entry for operating_system.service_discovery.
This entry is unsafe and it has not been unmocked, also

It looks to me the primary reason for this bug: 1450789.

Made the mocking safe by the usage of "with patch.object(..." usage

Change-Id: Ib0f18b65be04490f8f60ff878a7af512a5e9bed5
Closes-Bug: #1450789

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: name FK constraints

We didn't name the foreign keys constraint which is going to make
upgrade very painful in the future. Let's do that right now before
having 1.0 and freezing our schema.

Change-Id: I5b6902b9db7d8f74984df35b149bf0eb5d825b2c

commit_message:
Verify that each step provisioning went well

Use the serverspec hook to verify that the previous provisioning step
left the platform in an expected and correct state. It is a dependency
to go and run the next step.

commit_message:
Implement group related methods for LDAP backend

This patch implements three functions, empty in the LDAP backend,
which are necessary to obtain information about groups,
such as roles, projects and domains of the groups.

These are the functions:

- list_domain_ids_for_user
- list_domain_ids_for_groups

Change-Id: Ie0e2ad9b24add9e3a27a251e089e12acf36ce933
Closes-Bug: #1333712

commit_message:
Temporarily add trove plugin configuration

In order to move the trove configuration from devstack to trove,
we need to enable the plugin.  This should be done in a job config,
but since that can not be tested with a change and will break if
it lands before the plugin is moved, enable it in devstack-gate
to facilitate the transition.

Once the transition is complete, this can be removed.

Change-Id: I3506dec0e6097f9c2e9267110fdfb768faa23c85
Depends-On: I15667bf9c063e886755aef29056ef0028cbb1080

subject: Pass the flag for Identity v3 API only jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 9142, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'samuel-z', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-03 18:14:22.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Pass the flag for Identity v3 API only jobs

When DEVSTACK_GATE_IDENTITY_V3_ONLY is set to 1,
pass it as IDENTITY_V3_ONLY=True in the devstack
local.conf file.

Devstack will:
* Disable the v2 API in Keystone paste config;
* Set Tempest to skip Identity v2 tests and use
  v3 auth tokens to run all the other tests;
* Set Horizon to use v3 API and v3 auth tokens.

Change-Id: I345170430ced6c1443292a8f3dc3b9e6c105ee70
'}]
commit_message:
Pass the flag for Identity v3 API only jobs

When DEVSTACK_GATE_IDENTITY_V3_ONLY is set to 1,
pass it as IDENTITY_V3_ONLY=True in the devstack
local.conf file.

Devstack will:
* Disable the v2 API in Keystone paste config;
* Set Tempest to skip Identity v2 tests and use
  v3 auth tokens to run all the other tests;
* Set Horizon to use v3 API and v3 auth tokens.

Change-Id: I345170430ced6c1443292a8f3dc3b9e6c105ee70

subject: Allow overwriting sphinx builder from command line
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-04 19:03:51.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/builddoc.py'], 'message': 'Allow overwriting sphinx builder from command line

The build_sphinx setuptools command supports selection of a builder.
Support the behaviour of being able to explicitely select any builder
available to sphinx via "python setup.py build_sphinx -b linkcheck", not
just one of the builders specified in the configuration file.

Change-Id: I4c7ddcaf413e1bcc72550b3d920f8a777a710c97
'}]
commit_message:
Allow overwriting sphinx builder from command line

The build_sphinx setuptools command supports selection of a builder.
Support the behaviour of being able to explicitely select any builder
available to sphinx via "python setup.py build_sphinx -b linkcheck", not
just one of the builders specified in the configuration file.

Change-Id: I4c7ddcaf413e1bcc72550b3d920f8a777a710c97

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-24 17:42:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': 'incorrect SSL header used in example config

Updating the example local_settings.py to have HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO in
addition to HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTOCOL.  Only Django 1.4 uses
HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTOCOL and Django 1.5 and up uses HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO
which is probably the majority of installations.

Closes-bug: #1446836
Change-Id: Iebb854cf5e5586c6613b5755d4641ee896056334
'}]
commit_message:
incorrect SSL header used in example config

Updating the example local_settings.py to have HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO in
addition to HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTOCOL.  Only Django 1.4 uses
HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTOCOL and Django 1.5 and up uses HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO
which is probably the majority of installations.

Closes-bug: #1446836
Change-Id: Iebb854cf5e5586c6613b5755d4641ee896056334

subject: Fix can_send_version to check against the base client version
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-17 14:55:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_rpc_client.py', 'oslo/messaging/rpc/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix can_send_version to check against the base client version

Up until now clients would happily pass any version as long as there is
no version_cap specifed, disregarding the version of the Target that was
passed in to the constructor.

This now makes it fail if the version is higher than the one passed on
construction. A sideffect of this change is that now specifying the cap
that is higher than the version of the target passed in is that it will
always fail the can_send_version test.

Closes-bug: #1330916

Change-Id: Ic4f1b46bb331c3af9d041bc47fecf1f9bdb96871
'}]
commit_message:
Fix can_send_version to check against the base client version

Up until now clients would happily pass any version as long as there is
no version_cap specifed, disregarding the version of the Target that was
passed in to the constructor.

This now makes it fail if the version is higher than the one passed on
construction. A sideffect of this change is that now specifying the cap
that is higher than the version of the target passed in is that it will
always fail the can_send_version test.

Closes-bug: #1330916

Change-Id: Ic4f1b46bb331c3af9d041bc47fecf1f9bdb96871

subject: Add heartbeat support to kombu
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-12 08:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Add heartbeat support to kombu

This change adds heartbeat support for kombu by passing in heartbeat parameter
of default value 60 second and adding a thread(eventlet) that spawns after heartbeat/2
seconds to check for the connection.

This is a critical bug fix for cases where network connections are not reliable.
One of my test scenario had a NAT between nova-compute and the nova-conductor/nova-scheduler.
NAT devices are known to drop idle connections without telling corresponding parties of
the state of the connection. This behavior caused interesting 'hung' operation on nova side.

Here are the details:
Setup:

Nova-Conduct/Scheduler are running on a machine 'P' along with Broker
Nova-compute C is running on a virtual machine local at my workplace behind a NAT.
Both P, C are using Kombu 3.0.16 (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/kombu)

P creates a 'topic' exchange and create a Queue (nova_compute_<id>) which needs acknowledgements.
C waits for the message upon arrival sends an ack back to B.

Scenarios:

Positive:
P and C are connected to B, P publishes messages, C receives it and everything works fine.

Negative:
While C is connected to B,

step-1) I disconnect the 'virtual network' which disconnects the virtual machine C is running on.
So effectively C is not reachable anymore. (This should be similar to unplugging network cable to a machine)

At this point of time, I observed the following on broker machine:

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready and unacked messages =0

step-2) I then publish a message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =1

step-3) I then publish another message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =2

step-4) I plug 'connect' the network for C again but I never see the messages on the C they remain in the unacked state > 8 hrs (I didn't check after that).

Solution:
After the fix, the timeout value in Step-1,2,3 = 60 and step-4 succeeds and the messages are delivered.

Some references:

http://kombu.readthedocs.org/en/latest/reference/kombu.connection.html
https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html
https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/

Change-Id: Iee6866890aa24f46f03daae7e7f4b5d2c99dde65
"}]
commit_message:
Add heartbeat support to kombu

This change adds heartbeat support for kombu by passing in heartbeat parameter
of default value 60 second and adding a thread(eventlet) that spawns after heartbeat/2
seconds to check for the connection.

This is a critical bug fix for cases where network connections are not reliable.
One of my test scenario had a NAT between nova-compute and the nova-conductor/nova-scheduler.
NAT devices are known to drop idle connections without telling corresponding parties of
the state of the connection. This behavior caused interesting 'hung' operation on nova side.

Here are the details:
Setup:

Nova-Conduct/Scheduler are running on a machine 'P' along with Broker
Nova-compute C is running on a virtual machine local at my workplace behind a NAT.
Both P, C are using Kombu 3.0.16 (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/kombu)

P creates a 'topic' exchange and create a Queue (nova_compute_<id>) which needs acknowledgements.
C waits for the message upon arrival sends an ack back to B.

Scenarios:

Positive:
P and C are connected to B, P publishes messages, C receives it and everything works fine.

Negative:
While C is connected to B,

step-1) I disconnect the 'virtual network' which disconnects the virtual machine C is running on.
So effectively C is not reachable anymore. (This should be similar to unplugging network cable to a machine)

At this point of time, I observed the following on broker machine:

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready and unacked messages =0

step-2) I then publish a message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =1

step-3) I then publish another message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =2

step-4) I plug 'connect' the network for C again but I never see the messages on the C they remain in the unacked state > 8 hrs (I didn't check after that).

Solution:
After the fix, the timeout value in Step-1,2,3 = 60 and step-4 succeeds and the messages are delivered.

Some references:

http://kombu.readthedocs.org/en/latest/reference/kombu.connection.html
https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html
https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/

Change-Id: Iee6866890aa24f46f03daae7e7f4b5d2c99dde65

commit_message:
Trap formatting errors

Trap errors when trying to use translated messages as format strings so
translations don't break applications. Log the error, with the format
string (without interpolated values) and the original message so a bug
report can include it to make fixing the translation easier.

Change-Id: I4cd385dffc0b23c7cc6a663dd1700ac14a84c5d2
Closes-bug: #1339337

commit_message:
Brand new ReplyWaiter based on futures

Made reply handling code much simpler.
As a bonus overall performance of calls is doubled.

Removed one of the test cases that tested logic of previous
ReplyWaiter. Right now it's not needed since we don't have complex
conditions to care about.

New ReplyWaiter code is tested indirectly in test_impl_rabbit
test_send_receive test.

Change-Id: Ieba012e67a9857ca84cd5af4d3aed31ee09f6142

subject: Implement message flow control using link credit
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-24 16:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/opts.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/controller.py', 'tests/test_amqp_driver.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/driver.py'], 'message': "Implement message flow control using link credit

This change implements a scheme for managing link credit for consumer
links.  There are two different link use cases in this driver, each
of which employs its own credit management scheme:

The per-connection RPC reply link: the RPC sender is rate limited
given the synchronous nature of the RPC implementation.  Also, we need
to avoid having a 'slow' RPC client block an RPC server. Therefore the
shared RPC reply link does not backpressure senders.  It maintains a
credit level in the range of [$reply_credit/2 ... $reply_credit].

The per-target RPC server links: the RPC servers need to be able to
backpressure the broker should the server's backlog of incoming RPC
request messages becomes 'excessive'.  This is done by implementing a
high/low watermark on the queue of incoming RPC request messages.
When the number of queued RPC request messages becomes greater than
$listener_max_backlog, the driver will stop granting credit on all
receive links associated with the RPC server's subscription to its
target.  When the number of queued RPC requests drops to less than
$listener_low_backlog, credit will resume being granted to the receive
links.  The scheme for maintaining credit on the topic's receive links
(when not blocking) is similar to the method used for the
per-connection RPC reply link: the credit level on all links is
maintained in the range [$subscription_credit/2
... $subscription_credit].

Change-Id: If2a00139123d069d6968d6451d974d8aa183dcc4
Closes-Bug: #1367911
"}]
commit_message:
Implement message flow control using link credit

This change implements a scheme for managing link credit for consumer
links.  There are two different link use cases in this driver, each
of which employs its own credit management scheme:

The per-connection RPC reply link: the RPC sender is rate limited
given the synchronous nature of the RPC implementation.  Also, we need
to avoid having a 'slow' RPC client block an RPC server. Therefore the
shared RPC reply link does not backpressure senders.  It maintains a
credit level in the range of [$reply_credit/2 ... $reply_credit].

The per-target RPC server links: the RPC servers need to be able to
backpressure the broker should the server's backlog of incoming RPC
request messages becomes 'excessive'.  This is done by implementing a
high/low watermark on the queue of incoming RPC request messages.
When the number of queued RPC request messages becomes greater than
$listener_max_backlog, the driver will stop granting credit on all
receive links associated with the RPC server's subscription to its
target.  When the number of queued RPC requests drops to less than
$listener_low_backlog, credit will resume being granted to the receive
links.  The scheme for maintaining credit on the topic's receive links
(when not blocking) is similar to the method used for the
per-connection RPC reply link: the credit level on all links is
maintained in the range [$subscription_credit/2
... $subscription_credit].

Change-Id: If2a00139123d069d6968d6451d974d8aa183dcc4
Closes-Bug: #1367911

commit_message:
Remove set_time_override in timeutils

The set_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I4d4af4933237b2ab424329c66ce792e7cb4f2a00
Closes-Bug: #1266962

subject: Check cli parameter when checking if the option is already registered
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-02 12:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Check cli parameter when checking if the option is already registered

Currently, if we register some options using both register_opts()
and register_cli_opts(). The register_cli_opts() will ignore as
the option is though already registerd. Hence no option will
appear with '-h' parameter, and the option is not registered as
cli options.

I fix this bug by checking the cli parameter passed to the
_is_opt_registered() method.

Change-Id: Ib096157ea05a6bfb7a8da812a8f9190d925da88b
Closes-Bug: 1363808
"}]
commit_message:
Check cli parameter when checking if the option is already registered

Currently, if we register some options using both register_opts()
and register_cli_opts(). The register_cli_opts() will ignore as
the option is though already registerd. Hence no option will
appear with '-h' parameter, and the option is not registered as
cli options.

I fix this bug by checking the cli parameter passed to the
_is_opt_registered() method.

Change-Id: Ib096157ea05a6bfb7a8da812a8f9190d925da88b
Closes-Bug: 1363808
