commit_message:
Allow to reference values outside DEFAULT in substitution

This change allows use to reference values in form ${group.name}. User
also can reference values from the same group by omitting group name:
${.name}. Usage example:

  [DEFAULT]
  someservice_url=${someservice.url}
  [someservice]
  url=http://${.host}:${.port}
  host=someservice.example.com
  port=80

Change-Id: Iac68943e83975ac40afbc20a79a4c12bb1dcef34

Implements: blueprint group-option-interpolation

commit_message:
Support groups in option value interpolation

This change enhances the option value interpolation feature to support
interpolation across groups. The template syntax to reference an option
in another group is ${group.option} (the brackets are required).

Change-Id: I98dae021852f1ac646bd17f44d96717c7687fec8
Implements: blueprint group-option-interpolation

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-16 13:25:09.000000000', 'files': ['tests/security/test_listener_wrapper.py', 'oslo/messaging/transport.py', 'oslo/messaging/_security/dummy.py', 'tests/security/test_dummy_policy.py', 'oslo/messaging/security.py', 'scripts/secure_rpc_client.py', 'oslo/messaging/_security/__init__.py', 'scripts/secure_rpc_server.py', 'tests/security/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'oslo/messaging/_security/kite.py'], 'message': 'Adds message security plugins

and one for using kite.

Change-Id: Icbed9d0aee4c84bb396f58bcb7516797a97a515b
Implements: blueprint trusted-messaging
'}]
commit_message:
Adds message security plugins

This adds an optional plugin framework for message security. It
also provides two plugin implementations, a dummy pass through
and one for using kite.

Change-Id: Icbed9d0aee4c84bb396f58bcb7516797a97a515b
Implements: blueprint trusted-messaging

subject: Allow parsing of key/value lines with leading whitespace
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 11913, 'name': 'Brian Jarrett', 'email': 'celttechie@gmail.com', 'username': 'celttechie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-19 16:46:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/iniparser.py', 'tests/test_iniparser.py'], 'message': "Allow parsing of key/value lines with leading whitespace

Removing a hash from a line in a config file without also removing
the leading space on the line leads to a parsing error.  The
problem occurs because any line starting with a space is assumed
to be the second parameter in a 'multiline' key/value assignment.

The proposed fix allows for the multiline assignment and allows
any line to have leading whitespace by requiring than any
additional lines in a multiline assignment do not have colons or
equals signs.  If a line does have a colon or equals sign, it's
considered a new key/value assignment.

If and when configuration files are more standardized, this
parsing behavior should be revisited.  At this point, though, it
fixes the reported bug and passes all the other parsing tests as
well.

Closes-Bug: 1266832

Change-Id: Ie20fd3b99bb757c74ee00012539fc71e0d68fc16
"}]
commit_message:
Allow parsing of key/value lines with leading whitespace

Removing a hash from a line in a config file without also removing
the leading space on the line leads to a parsing error.  The
problem occurs because any line starting with a space is assumed
to be the second parameter in a 'multiline' key/value assignment.

The proposed fix allows for the multiline assignment and allows
any line to have leading whitespace by requiring than any
additional lines in a multiline assignment do not have colons or
equals signs.  If a line does have a colon or equals sign, it's
considered a new key/value assignment.

If and when configuration files are more standardized, this
parsing behavior should be revisited.  At this point, though, it
fixes the reported bug and passes all the other parsing tests as
well.

Closes-Bug: 1266832

Change-Id: Ie20fd3b99bb757c74ee00012539fc71e0d68fc16

commit_message:
Warn if new and deprecated options are both present

Its possibly a misconfiguration if both new and deprecated
versions of an option are configured at the same time.  The
recommendation has been to log a warning when this is detected.

I've included group, name, and value for any such options as
debugging aid.

Change-Id: I10951d0ec4df2688540e95eef3dd7a913a5da4b9
Closes-Bug: 1319868

My suggestion is to provide a load_config_file() function that simply

commit_message:
Add load_config_file function

When developing I4b860e3f7901b00b1c78f7df1f2219132f347239 I found it
difficult provide a small, additional config-file snippet that
unit-tests could use to test the new config-option provided.

My suggestion is to provide a load_config_file() function that simply
parses adds a given config-file into the existing name-space.

I think this would enhance the ability of certain unit-tests, such as
for the change above, to be "end-to-end" ... that is to test the
values are read correctly from the config file into oslo.config and
used correctly in the program.

Change-Id: I26f5132e6323340617dd9448661e325ff3f509e3

commit_message:
Add a ProxyConfigOpts derivative (WIP)

Add a new subclass of _CachedConfigOpts that can ask a provided
object for values (that provided object could be a dictionary,
a webservice, something else...), it will also be able to notify
some provided object when options are registered, unregistered and
so-on (so that the provided object may adjust its own information
if it needs to).

An example that shows the usage of this is at:

http://paste.ubuntu.com/9113641/

With output at:

http://paste.ubuntu.com/9113668/

Change-Id: I21b1914b490f3ac5722a5263a764c5eb60a4073e

subject: Refactor config opts, deriving from common base (WIP)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-20 05:15:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Refactor config opts, deriving from common base (WIP)

Start to shift the functionality of the config opts class
into a base class that allows for other implementations of
config opts that can provide there own implementations of
the base abstract methods (perhaps providing a '_do_get' that
fetchs from a remote source, or from a dictionary, or from
elsewhere).

This is a first step at decoupling oslo.config from being so
tied to CLI and config file parsing, extraction... so that in
the future more flexible and alternative sources can easily
co-exist.

Change-Id: Id2e194fbdf7310c3cf704f1a1b96f07292420d3b
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor config opts, deriving from common base (WIP)

Start to shift the functionality of the config opts class
into a base class that allows for other implementations of
config opts that can provide there own implementations of
the base abstract methods (perhaps providing a '_do_get' that
fetchs from a remote source, or from a dictionary, or from
elsewhere).

This is a first step at decoupling oslo.config from being so
tied to CLI and config file parsing, extraction... so that in
the future more flexible and alternative sources can easily
co-exist.

Change-Id: Id2e194fbdf7310c3cf704f1a1b96f07292420d3b

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-30 07:33:07.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/rpc/server.py', 'tests/rpc/test_dispatcher.py', 'oslo/messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py'], 'message': "Add an option for late acknowledgement in RPC

In order to use RPC cast as a simple work queue, the RPC dispatcher
must be able to send the ACK only after it's finished executing

commit_message:
Add an option for late acknowledgement in RPC

In order to use RPC cast as a simple work queue, the RPC dispatcher
must be able to send the ACK only after it's finished executing
the callback, so the message can be delivered to another server
in case this one crashes mid-callback.

The parameter is optional and the default behaviour doesn't change
so it won't impact the current use of RPC in OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Idaa03271dc4b054979df276ca47b583900b5062b
Closes-bug: #1350212

commit_message:
`publisher`function separated into ZmqProxy method

In the `consume` method of ZmqProxy class declared a function named
`publisher`. This function contains reach socket data sending logic. This
function became the instance method named `_publisher`.

Such an approach is much easier to test and improve logic of the
function.

Change-Id: I769f0616726785a6b0e60d84072f7446b5a29e34

subject: Topic object
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-08 15:18:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/drivers/test_impl_zmq.py', 'oslo/messaging/target.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_zmq.py'], 'message': 'Topic object

Topic manipulations are significant part of Zero MQ driver. All of these
actions were performed in-line as string operations. This kind of design
is very difficult to debug and modify. We to have a single entry point
for topic to reduce the described issues.

* Created Topic object with appropriate methods to manipulate and
control topic value.
* Extended Target object to use Topic object with normal Target
features.
* To restrict and standardize topic length used md5 hexdigest (with
length of 32 chars) value as base topic name. md5 used to have guaranteed the
same value for the same seed in different threads or even nodes.

Change-Id: Icd674d92c94be21ed9ac037fa6c5bd132b00340e
'}]
commit_message:
Topic object

Topic manipulations are significant part of Zero MQ driver. All of these
actions were performed in-line as string operations. This kind of design
is very difficult to debug and modify. We to have a single entry point
for topic to reduce the described issues.

* Created Topic object with appropriate methods to manipulate and
control topic value.
* Extended Target object to use Topic object with normal Target
features.
* To restrict and standardize topic length used md5 hexdigest (with
length of 32 chars) value as base topic name. md5 used to have guaranteed the
same value for the same seed in different threads or even nodes.

Change-Id: Icd674d92c94be21ed9ac037fa6c5bd132b00340e

commit_message:
Reduce global CONF usage in zmq driver

Reduced usage of global CONF object. Implemented a decorator for lazy
options registration. Each essence uses config options is independent
from others. Registered two options groups for zmq driver.

Since this patch the tests require `eventlet`. `eventlet` added to
test-requirements-py3.txt.

Change-Id: I2905cb288617052bf1c039aef000aeeee6468e15
Closes-Bug: #1373382

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-28 16:49:26.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Auto-delete queues were deleted on RabbitMQ failover

When RPC client starts listening to reply queue and got disconnected from RabbitMQ,
reply queue got deleted because it was marked as auto-delete and no more consumers
were present.

This fix replaces auto-delete with queue 1H expiration. So clients have
up to an hour to reconnect to RaqbbitMQ prior to server's reply gets lost

Change-Id: Ic1a20c309ff90618f715f4034847e6e159c486e8
Closes-Bug: #1349301
"}]
commit_message:
Auto-delete queues were deleted on RabbitMQ failover

When RPC client starts listening to reply queue and got disconnected from RabbitMQ,
reply queue got deleted because it was marked as auto-delete and no more consumers
were present.

This fix replaces auto-delete with queue 1H expiration. So clients have
up to an hour to reconnect to RaqbbitMQ prior to server's reply gets lost

Change-Id: Ic1a20c309ff90618f715f4034847e6e159c486e8
Closes-Bug: #1349301

commit_message:
Add API for introspecting VMDKs

This change adds vmdk.py and test_vmdk.py(correspoing unit tests)
to oslo/vmware and tests/ respectively.
vmdk.py has a class API which has the following methods
introspecting VMDKs(monolithicSparse, monolithicFlat,
streamOptimized):

    *get_adapter_type
    *get_disk_type
    *get_virtual_size

Change-Id: I2e9966790b7d0dd9b669aa0c10bea2f3a2c459f7

subject: Traverse children list to check if any worker stop
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-03 02:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': "Traverse children list to check if any worker stop

Currently Neutron server spawns two green threads for api and rpc
job. In _wait_child, both green threads get pid of the stopped
worker from os.waitpid, but if the pid is not in the green thread's
children list, the stopped worker is not restarted.

Considering this two green threads are in the same process, api
green thread may get a pid belonging to a worker forked by rpc
green thread and will not restart the worker. We need to traverse
the children list of each green thread in _wait_child to ensure
stopped worker can be properly recognized.

Change-Id: I056235b11f3e239a8a7e78a507e002978a306b8c
Closes-Bug: #1384580
"}]
commit_message:
Traverse children list to check if any worker stop

Currently Neutron server spawns two green threads for api and rpc
job. In _wait_child, both green threads get pid of the stopped
worker from os.waitpid, but if the pid is not in the green thread's
children list, the stopped worker is not restarted.

Considering this two green threads are in the same process, api
green thread may get a pid belonging to a worker forked by rpc
green thread and will not restart the worker. We need to traverse
the children list of each green thread in _wait_child to ensure
stopped worker can be properly recognized.

Change-Id: I056235b11f3e239a8a7e78a507e002978a306b8c
Closes-Bug: #1384580

subject: Fix strings for python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-08 14:41:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_jsonutils.py', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix strings for python3

Use six to detect unicode strings for python2

subject: Make tox use develop mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-06 03:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make tox use develop mode

Currently running tox fails on a system where pbr isn't installed in
the base-environment.  This is because "python setup.py sdist" isn't
run in the virtualenv and thus the package gets built as
"UNKNOWN-0.0.0.zip" and subsequently fails.

Running tox in develop mode seems to be the standard way things are
done in other parts of the projects.

Also copy in some other standard settings; install_command using pip
(which requires minversion = 1.6) and handing testr args

Change-Id: I9017d0bbc0e606a28b70ca20fff3f58068fc062d
'}]
commit_message:
Make tox use develop mode

Currently running tox fails on a system where pbr isn't installed in
the base-environment.  This is because "python setup.py sdist" isn't
run in the virtualenv and thus the package gets built as
"UNKNOWN-0.0.0.zip" and subsequently fails.

Running tox in develop mode seems to be the standard way things are
done in other parts of the projects.

Also copy in some other standard settings; install_command using pip
(which requires minversion = 1.6) and handing testr args

Change-Id: I9017d0bbc0e606a28b70ca20fff3f58068fc062d

subject: Prevent a UnicodeDecodeError in the s3token middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-25 16:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_s3_token_middleware.py', 'keystoneclient/middleware/s3_token.py'], 'message': 'Prevent a UnicodeDecodeError in the s3token middleware

Mixing "str" and "unicode" can lead to a UnicodeDecodeError. We encode unicode
values before using them with text strings.

The bug occurs if the URL contains a non-ASCII character in the tenant id:
"hého" in "/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/hého" ("/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/h\xc3\xa9ho" in UTF-8) for
example.

The bug occurs on Python 2 in s3_token.py because the tenant id is retrieved
from identity_info['access']['token']['tenant'] and identity_info comes from
resp.json().

The problem is that in Python, the JSON decoder always create Unicode strings.
Example in Python 2:

>>> json.loads('{"key": "value"}') {u'key': u'value'}

There is no issue in Python 3, since all text strings are Unicode.

Change-Id: Ib7fdf60f8369ea9546fcd92f1ac385c777478d10
Closes-Bug: #1428706
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent a UnicodeDecodeError in the s3token middleware

Mixing "str" and "unicode" can lead to a UnicodeDecodeError. We encode unicode
values before using them with text strings.

The bug occurs if the URL contains a non-ASCII character in the tenant id:
"hého" in "/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/hého" ("/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/h\xc3\xa9ho" in UTF-8) for
example.

The bug occurs on Python 2 in s3_token.py because the tenant id is retrieved
from identity_info['access']['token']['tenant'] and identity_info comes from
resp.json().

The problem is that in Python, the JSON decoder always create Unicode strings.
Example in Python 2:

>>> json.loads('{"key": "value"}') {u'key': u'value'}

There is no issue in Python 3, since all text strings are Unicode.

Change-Id: Ib7fdf60f8369ea9546fcd92f1ac385c777478d10
Closes-Bug: #1428706

revisions:

For Kilo we switched to using stable/* instead of proposed/* as the
pre-release branch. Update scripts to match that.

We also stop waiting for tarballs to be built and compare them to
previous branch tarballs -- we can't rely on that test given how much
time it takes to get branch tarballs generated those days.

Change-Id: I46f069ccb5e5a6baa9c768f7d5e1c7d1237e6546
"}]
commit_message:
Update rccut and rcdelivery to match Kilo process

For Kilo we switched to using stable/* instead of proposed/* as the
pre-release branch. Update scripts to match that.

We also stop waiting for tarballs to be built and compare them to
previous branch tarballs -- we can't rely on that test given how much
time it takes to get branch tarballs generated those days.

Change-Id: I46f069ccb5e5a6baa9c768f7d5e1c7d1237e6546

commit_message:
Don't short circuit when projects fails to clone

This change adds a check to propose_update.sh,
avoiding it to go into fatal error when a project
fails to clone.

Just report the incident and move onto the next
project.

commit_message:
Adds scenario for network-large-ops

* Spins up multiple instances in one nova call as a regular user.
* VMs are connected to network (unlike test_large_ops)
* Verifies instances are ACTIVE.
* Assigns Floating IP and verifies connectivity to each instance.

Pulls logic for bulk_servers_create from test_large_ops to manager

Adds network-large-ops to tox.ini

Changes required from devstack:

In nova.conf:
quota_instances = -1
quota_cores = -1
quota_ram = -1
quota_floating_ips = -1
quota_fixed_ips = -1
quota_metadata_items = -1
quota_injected_files = -1
quota_injected_file_path_bytes = -1
quota_security_groups = -1
quota_security_group_rules = -1
quota_key_pairs = -1

In neutron.conf:
quota_network = -1
quota_subnet = -1
quota_port = -1
quota_security_group = -1
quota_security_group_rule = -1
quota_vip = -1
quota_pool = -1
quota_member = -1
quota_health_monitors = -1
quota_router = -1
quota_floatingip = -1

In tempest.conf
tenant_network_mask_bit should allow for $large_ops_number IP addresses in
tenant

Change-Id: I5593393dc30262b4b28f4274695d604825d29383

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 11:27:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hosts/os-refresh-config/configure.d/51-hosts'], 'message': 'Downcase /etc/hosts entries

The entries received from Heat are based on Heat names of
OS::Nova::Server resources, which can contain uppercase letters. However
the hostnames set by Nova are lowercase. This can make the actual
hostname differ from entries in /etc/hosts, which can make the output of
`hostname -f` differ from `facter fqdn`, which can cause failed Puppet
runs.

This patch makes sure that the /etc/hosts entries that Heat adds are
lowercase.

Change-Id: Iec5b6450c5730c081c8f2ca4d6c9786b956c87d5
Partial-Bug: #1447497
'}]
commit_message:
Downcase /etc/hosts entries

The entries received from Heat are based on Heat names of
OS::Nova::Server resources, which can contain uppercase letters. However
the hostnames set by Nova are lowercase. This can make the actual
hostname differ from entries in /etc/hosts, which can make the output of
`hostname -f` differ from `facter fqdn`, which can cause failed Puppet
runs.

This patch makes sure that the /etc/hosts entries that Heat adds are
lowercase.

Change-Id: Iec5b6450c5730c081c8f2ca4d6c9786b956c87d5
Partial-Bug: #1447497

commit_message:
Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Saml2 authentication plugins were initially extracted to the federation
repository, however we don't want to lump all these plugins together as
they may have very different dependencies and jobs.

Rename repo to more accurately reflect contents.

Related governance change is Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2

Change-Id: Ie23f0c3a1f3e0a65baabe3dbd19091908da1aba2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 08:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'etc/nova/policy.json', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Enable tenant/user specific instance filtering

This patch enables tenant and user specific filtering.
Prior to this, one could not filter list of servers on
tenant or user basis.
For example -
nova list --tenant <tenant_id> [--user <user_id>]
This was not giving desirable output.
This patch removes this limitation.
Note in above that currently python-client does not implement
"--user" argument. I will add a patch for that also.
Thus one can filter out servers tenant and user basis.
If you are not passing user info then current context
user will be entertained.
Similarly, If you are not passing tenant info,
this will entertain current context tenant.
Closes-Bug: #1398329
Author: Mh Raies raiesmh08@gmail.com

(cherry picked from commit cf209713dff8bc84e0f251f9f2dc2a2e6fcf0ae0)

Co-Authored-By: Michal Jura mjura@suse.com
Change-Id: I53ca239395b538bc103a8e5cefc728142a034f20
'}]
commit_message:
Enable tenant/user specific instance filtering

This patch enables tenant and user specific filtering.
Prior to this, one could not filter list of servers on
tenant or user basis.
For example -
nova list --tenant <tenant_id> [--user <user_id>]
This was not giving desirable output.
This patch removes this limitation.
Note in above that currently python-client does not implement
"--user" argument. I will add a patch for that also.
Thus one can filter out servers tenant and user basis.
If you are not passing user info then current context
user will be entertained.
Similarly, If you are not passing tenant info,
this will entertain current context tenant.
Closes-Bug: #1398329
Author: Mh Raies raiesmh08@gmail.com

(cherry picked from commit cf209713dff8bc84e0f251f9f2dc2a2e6fcf0ae0)

Co-Authored-By: Michal Jura mjura@suse.com
Change-Id: I53ca239395b538bc103a8e5cefc728142a034f20

subject: Add experimental Identity v3 jobs to devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 16:43:48.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add experimental Identity v3 jobs to devstack

Identity API v3 jobs use the auth_version=v3
setting in Tempest, which uses v3 auth tokens.

In order to make Devstack use only tokens v3 and
Identity API v3, some work still need to be done.

This change enables an experimental check on
Devstack to be used on the incoming Devstack
patches.

Partially-implements: bp/keystone-v3-jobs

Change-Id: Iba9ed29cbc726c2abdb0a99ec789af949169a920
'}]
commit_message:
Add experimental Identity v3 jobs to devstack

Identity API v3 jobs use the auth_version=v3
setting in Tempest, which uses v3 auth tokens.

In order to make Devstack use only tokens v3 and
Identity API v3, some work still need to be done.

This change enables an experimental check on
Devstack to be used on the incoming Devstack
patches.

Partially-implements: bp/keystone-v3-jobs

Change-Id: Iba9ed29cbc726c2abdb0a99ec789af949169a920
